body: No licking the cookie, just send a PR!

Hi Guys,
As far as I understand the issue is that the characters(from bracketed paste) do not reach the typebuffer. And the characters from typebuffer is used to put characters into the recording register.

Can anyone please give me some input/advice where should I start looking to find a solution to this issue?
 
 P.S. Please let me know if this is not the right place to discuss this and I will remove my comment.

One idea for fixing this would be to manually check `reg_recording()` in `vim.paste`, and append the text to the currently-recording macro register: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/648d6426c863c75643d714d45f4b67e19ac6944a/runtime/lua/vim/_editor.lua#L237

> in `vim.paste` it still had the content from the previous recording.

Oh, right. Could handle the `RecordingLeave` event, but it happens *before* the register is updated. And the handler would need to insert the pasted text in exactly the right place (in the register). Though it should be possible to set some state during `vim.paste()` which would give a `RecordingLeave` handler enough info to fixup the macro register (on `CursorMoved` or whatever).

> I also tried using `nvim_feedkeys`

what parameters exactly? The "i" and/or "x" flags of feedkeys() might be relevant. Or maybe "t". We already use feedkeys for cmdline mode: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/5792546777332361a9ac49107e46149c703de90e/runtime/lua/vim/_editor.lua#L259-L261

rename.from: Bracketed paste doesn't work during macro recording
rename.to: bracketed paste not stored in macro recording

body:
> what parameters exactly? The "i" and/or "x" flags of feedkeys() might be relevant.

I tried it with the "i" flag. Will try it with the other flags and also the other things you mentioned.

issue.title: fix: bracketed paste not stored in macro recording

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Problem: While macro recording the content from the bracketed paste do not reach the register

Solution: Use feed_keys to simulate typing of the pasted content while recording is going on

Fixes [neovim/neovim#28561](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/28561)

body: Maybe it's necessary to introduce `<PasteStart>` and `<PasteEnd>` to indicate the start and end of the pasted text in the register (and possibly redo buffer as well)? Similar to what was introduced in [Vim 8.0.0210](https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ec2da36ca48b40c0654b32a8d2c9f52e796daa5e), but using `nvim_paste` instead of entering Insert mode.

> introduce `<PasteStart>` and `<PasteEnd>`

Removing those fixed some very irritating bugs at the time...

> > introduce `<PasteStart>` and `<PasteEnd>`
> 
> Removing those fixed some very irritating bugs at the time...

Yes, but those bugs won't be present if they use `nvim_paste` instead of Insert mode typing. Plus it can also fix the 'autoindent' problem when redoing a paste (which currently uses Insert mode typing).

Let's try to avoid reintroducing `<PasteStart>`. It adds even more complication. And depending on how we would use it, it's either (1) redundant with the existing paste "phases", or (2) would result in multiple `<PasteStart>` inputs for a single paste "stream", which would raise new questions/problems.
I don't think those problems are relevant here, as when repeating a paste, all pasted text should have been added to the redo/record buffer, so there are no "phases".

There are phases during bracketed-paste (unless it was changed to always buffer the entire thing until the end, and call `vim.paste` only once?). 

Another question: if we reintroduced `<PasteStart>`, and UIs send that, then `vim.paste` wouldn't be invoked, which would be a regression.
I was not suggesting using these two keys for UI. I was suggesting using these two keys for internal paste repeating, so that repeating a paste also calls `vim.paste()`.

issue.title: fix(paste): improve repeating of pasted text

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
- Fixes 'autoindent' being applied during redo.
- Makes redoing a large paste significantly faster.
- Stores pasted text in the register being recorded.

Fix #28561
